The Code 4 Puerto Rico Hack Night is for those who want to:

  • Get work done on civic projects
  • Want to change things at our local communities
  • See things differntly
  • Learn about open data, smart cities, and open government

Civic Hacking

Code 4 Puerto Rico challenges participants discuss, create and work together on projects that directly affect our local communities and beyond. Inspired in 2015 by Ernesto Sirirolli TEDx Speaker - Shut Up and Listen; we are advocates to listen first and then act. Our mission is to connect citizins to technology that facilitates their daily lives by donating our time and skills creating effective solutions that solves community problems. We are an inclusive community all citizens are invited to paticipate. We are not just programmers... we are teachers, architects, designers, students, local goverment, mothers, teens, and we are you the community. If you like to create change taking change by your own hands we invite you to join us at our hack nights!

About Us and Contact

Our community partner is:

Code of Conduct:

All members and organizers of Code4PuertoRico strictly adhere to the Code of Conduct and Anti-Harassment Policy

Members and guest can also report violations to the code of conduct directly to Code for Ameria at the following email: safespace@codeforamerica.org

Got questions about the event or have a project to present? Email us at code4puertorico@gmail.com.
